009package imagingbook.common.math.nonlinear;
010
011import static org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresFactory.model;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateMatrixFunction;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateVectorFunction;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.GaussNewtonOptimizer;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresFactory;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresOptimizer;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresOptimizer.Optimum;
019import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresProblem;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.optim.SimpleVectorValueChecker;
023
024/**
025 * <p>
026 * This class defines static methods for simplified access to nonlinear
027 * least-squares solvers in Apache Commons Math, hiding much of the available
028 * configuration options. If other than default settings are needed, the
029 * original (Apache Commons Math) API should be used. See the Appendix C of [1]
030 * for additional details and examples.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
034 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
035 * </p>
036 * 
037 * @author WB
038 *
039 */
040public abstract class NonlinearLeastSquares {
041        
042        private NonlinearLeastSquares() {}
043        
044        public static int MaxEvaluations = 1000;
045        public static int MaxIterations = 1000;
046        public static double Tolerance = 1e-6;
047        
048        /**
049         * Solves the nonlinear least-squares problem defined by the arguments.
050         * Delegates to the Levenberg-Marquardt method.
051         * 
052         * @param V the "value" function, V(p) must return a vector for the current parameters p
053         * @param J the "Jacobian" function, J(p) must return a matrix for the current parameters p
054         * @param z the vector of observed ("target") values
055         * @param p0 initial parameter vector
056         * @return the vector of optimal parameters
057         */
058        public static RealVector solveNLS(MultivariateVectorFunction V, MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
059                        RealVector z, RealVector p0) {
060                return solveLevenvergMarquardt(V, J, z, p0);
061        }
062        
063        /**
064         * Solves the nonlinear least-squares problem defined by the arguments
065         * using Levenberg-Marquardt optimization.
066         * 
067         * @param V the "value" function, V(p) must return a vector for the current parameters p
068         * @param J the "Jacobian" function, J(p) must return a matrix for the current parameters p
069         * @param z the vector of observed ("target") values
070         * @param p0 initial parameter vector
071         * @return the vector of optimal parameters
072         */
073        public static RealVector solveLevenvergMarquardt(MultivariateVectorFunction V, MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
074                                                RealVector z, RealVector p0) {
075                LeastSquaresProblem problem = makeProblem(V, J, z, p0);
076                LeastSquaresOptimizer optimizer = new LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer();
077                Optimum solution = optimizer.optimize(problem);
078                //System.out.println("iterations = " + solution.getIterations());
079                return solution.getPoint();
080        }
081        
082        /**
083        * Solves the nonlinear least-squares problem defined by the arguments
084         * using Gauss-Newton optimization.
085         * 
086         * @param V the "value" function, V(p) must return a vector for the current parameters p
087         * @param J the "Jacobian" function, J(p) must return a matrix for the current parameters p
088         * @param z the vector of observed ("target") values
089         * @param p0 initial parameter vector
090         * @return the vector of optimal parameters
091         */
092        public static RealVector solveGaussNewton(MultivariateVectorFunction V, MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
093                                                RealVector z, RealVector p0) {
094                LeastSquaresProblem problem = makeProblem(V, J, z, p0);
095                LeastSquaresOptimizer optimizer = new GaussNewtonOptimizer();
096                Optimum solution = optimizer.optimize(problem);
097                //System.out.println("iterations = " + solution.getIterations());
098                return solution.getPoint();
099        }
100        
101        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
102        
103        private static LeastSquaresProblem makeProblem(MultivariateVectorFunction V, MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
104                                        RealVector observed, RealVector start) {        
105                return LeastSquaresFactory.create(model(V, J), observed, start,
106                        LeastSquaresFactory.evaluationChecker(new SimpleVectorValueChecker(Tolerance, Tolerance)),
107                        MaxEvaluations, MaxIterations);
108        }
109        
110        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
111        // book version
112        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
113        
114        public static RealVector solveNLS2(
115                        MultivariateVectorFunction V, 
116                        MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
117                        RealVector z, RealVector p0) 
118        {
119                LeastSquaresProblem problem = 
120                                LeastSquaresFactory.create(model(V, J), z, p0, null,
121                                                MaxEvaluations, MaxIterations);
122                LeastSquaresOptimizer optimizer = new LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer();
123                Optimum solution = optimizer.optimize(problem);
124//              System.out.println("iterations = " + solution.getIterations());
125                if (solution.getIterations() > MaxIterations)
126                        return null;
127                else 
128                        return solution.getPoint();
129        }
130        
131        // migrated to tests: ----------------------------------------------

199}
